page.title: 18Life in Penberth, St. Levan.
page.content: My name is Jane Matthews, I am ten years old. Every day I wake up at about half past six. My dad is up at about four o'clock. He is a fisherman. Here in Penberth I live near the sea. Out of my window I can see the sea and in my other window I can see the slip. Every morning I get up at seven o'clock. I go down stairs and have breakfast. Then I wash with my little brother. My brother is only two and is called Thomas. My sister, Tracy, is fourteen and goes to St. Just school. My dad is called Richard and my mum is called Jackie. When I am dressed and ready for school I go and get Harry who is six and walks up the road with me. We get picked up by a taxi. At Porthcurno we pick up Richard, Helen, James and Rupert. School is at Bottoms it starts at nine o'clock and finishes at 3-30p.m. I like to swim in summer.
